definition[0]: a market-oriented economy, society, system etc is one with FREE MARKETs where people can buy and sell freely and where most companies are not owned by the state
example[0]: He plans to replace the rigid planned economy with a more market-oriented one.
definition[1]: market-oriented activities are designed to lead to a more market-oriented economy
example[1]: Hungary and Poland were ahead of their neighbors in adopting market-oriented policies.
definition[2]: a company that is market-oriented tries to design and sell products that satisfy customers’ needs
